intro: Cercouratea brevipes, commonly known as the short-footed fern, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Araceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers that are typically surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. Native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
